instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message:
Hi all,

got in a MacBook stil wet, alot of wet.
cleaned it out, no signs of damage maby because it came in wet and the spill happend like 10 minutes before.

now its up and running nice and smooth.
but the battery percentage is jumping when the charger is pluged 100% when unpluged 91% (or less depends on usage)

then i plugin the charger pling 100% again.


works great on charger and on battery but the percentage is jumping.
any idear.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message: Even tried a known good battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message:
yes 2, know good ones, and just had one new come in today, all the same issue.

also replaced the charge port same thing

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message: Is it only on the login screen this thing happens or have you tried logging into the system and make a reboot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message: Run the battery diagnostic in AST? Check for hidden corrosion on the joints of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and surrounding components. I have had a completely clean board have one speck of corrosion on the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message:
i also login and reboot multiple times,.
then after swapping battery and charger poort again multiple times.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with the water still in it !!! sooking
threads.message: I would suspect corrosion under the SMC.
